Key Match Events: The New York Knicks outscored the Oklahoma City Thunder 36-21 in the second quarter.
The Thunder outscored the Knicks 63-41 in the second half.
Jalen Brunson recorded 22 points but missed all five threes and had two costly turnovers.
Aaron Wiggins scored 19 points off the bench, making a significant impact in the fourth quarter.
The Chicago Bulls outscored the New York Knicks 41-17 in the third quarter.
Coby White scored 33 points, making nine threes, which was decisive in the Bulls' victory.
Pre-Game Insights: The New York Knicks entered the game with a nine-game winning streak, while the Oklahoma City Thunder had a 13-game streak.
Post-Match Reflections: Karl-Anthony Towns refused to yield to defeat, finishing with 44 points and 16 rebounds in the fourth quarter.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was the second night of a back-to-back for the Knicks.
Derrick Rose was honored during the game.
